article.headline: Rice 76, Fresno State 68
article.story: FRESNO, Calif. (AP) -- Michael Harris scored 22 of his 30 points in the second half to help Rice beat Fresno State 76-68 Monday night. Brock Gillespie added 15 points and Jason McKrieth scored 14 for the Owls (14-10, 8-6 Western Athletic Conference). Rice moved a half-game ahead of the Bulldogs and into a tie with Louisiana Tech for third place in the conference. Mustafa Al-Sayyad and Donovan Morris scored 14 points apiece to lead Fresno State (14-11, 8-7). Al-Sayyad added nine rebounds, and Kevin Bell had nine assists. The game featured 17 lead changes and six ties as Rice topped Fresno State for the fourth straight time and sixth time in the past seven meetings between the teams. Trailing 61-56, the Owls outscored the Bulldogs 18-7 in the final six minutes to win the game. Rice outrebounded Fresno State 42-29, including 18-11 on the offensive glass. The Owls also outscored the Bulldogs 32-12 in the paint. After Rice used a 12-2 run to jump out to a 21-12 lead, Fresno State closed the first half by outscoring the Owls 24-13 to take a two-point halftime lead.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
